title: Mark Aguiar - Wikipedia
snippet: Aguiar was an assistant professor of economics at the University of Chicago Booth School of Business between 1999 and 2004, a senior economist at the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston from 2004 to 2006, and a tenured associate professor of economics at the University of Rochester from 2006 to 2011.

title: Mark Aguiar - Mark Aguiar
snippet: Professor Aguiar received his Ph.D. in economics from MIT in 1999. He began his academic career at the University of Chicago's Graduate School of Business before moving to the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston in 2004 and then to the University of Rochester in 2006.

title: Mark Aguiar | Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis
snippet: Mark received a B.A. in history and Chinese from Brown University and a Ph.D. in economics from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. He specializes in macroeconomics and international economics, and his research focuses on models of consumption and savings. Mark's interests include life cycle consumption and savings, sovereign debt, and current account dynamics.

title: Mark Aguiar | IDEAS/RePEc
snippet: Mark Aguiar & Manuel Amador & Hugo Hopenhayn & Iván Werning, 2016. "Take the Short Route: Equilibrium Default and Debt Maturity," NBER Working Papers 22847, National Bureau of Economic Research, Inc. Mark Aguiar & Manuel Amador & Hugo Hopenhayn & Iván Werning, 2019.

title: Research - Mark Aguiar
snippet: Aguiar, Mark, Manuel Amador, Doireann Fitzgerald (2025): “Tariff Wars and Net Foreign Assets”.
